sentences.en: During festival, in every country, Christendom all holds ceremonious souvenir ceremony.
sentences.cn: 节日期间, 各国基督教徒都举行隆重的纪念仪式.

sentences.en: He unveiled the picture with a ceremonious gesture.
sentences.cn: 他郑重其事地为这幅画揭幕.

sentences.en: Last, we'll celebrate ceremonious sum - up meeting .
sentences.cn: 最后我们还将举行隆重的 总结会.

sentences.en: Miao New Year is the most important and ceremonious festival in the Miao community.
sentences.cn: 苗年是苗族同胞最隆重、最重要的节日.

sentences.en: Music A showy or ceremonious passage, such as a fanfare.
sentences.cn: 装饰乐句,花式吹奏:一段炫耀或讲究仪式的音乐, 例如小号曲.

sentences.en: Putting on a hat can be a ceremonious act, an elegant gesture in the ritual of dressing.
sentences.cn: 戴帽子被看作一种礼节性的举动， 是着装仪式上一个优雅的举动。

sentences.en: Such a ceremonious opening, but it had nothing practical in it.
sentences.cn: 把剪彩仪式搞得这么隆重, 纯粹是摆花架子.

sentences.en: The Spring Festival is the most ceremonious traditional festival, we the Chinese nation is the most festive atmosphere all holidays a festival.
sentences.cn: 春节是我们中华民族最隆重的传统节日，是所有的节日中最有节日氛围的一个节日。

sentences.en: Their ceremonious greetings did not seem heartfelt.
sentences.cn: 他们隆重的欢迎看起来并不衷心.

sentences.en: To bring, offer, or give, often in a formal or ceremonious way.
sentences.cn: 把， 提供，或给予，往往在正式或隆重的方式下进行。

sentences.en: When their bodies arrived in Shanghai, all walks of life in Shanghai held ceremonious funeral service for them.
sentences.cn: 其灵榇抵达上海后，上海社会各界为之举行了隆重的祭奠活动。

trans.tran_cn: 好礼仪的，讲究礼节的，正式的，隆重
trans.tran_en: done in a formal serious way, as if you were in a ceremony
